overview:
Shadow Watch is a Visual Studio Code extension that provides continuous code architecture monitoring and AI-powered documentation generation. It automatically analyzes code on every save, detecting architecture issues like god objects, circular dependencies, dead code, and complex functions. The extension generates LLM-ready insights specifically formatted for AI assistants like Cursor, ChatGPT, and other language models, allowing developers to quickly get AI help with refactoring and code quality improvements. Shadow Watch supports nine programming languages including Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, Java, Go, Rust, C/C++, Ruby, and PHP.

Developers interact with Shadow Watch through a dedicated sidebar in VS Code that displays a health score, categorized issues (errors, warnings, info), and one-click copy buttons for sharing insights with AI assistants. The extension offers multiple output formats optimized for different AI tools, making it easy to get context-aware suggestions from language models. Users can analyze entire workspaces, individual files, or let the extension monitor continuously in the background. All insights are clickable, allowing developers to navigate directly to problem areas in their code.

Beyond static analysis, Shadow Watch uses AI providers (OpenAI and Anthropic) to generate comprehensive documentation including product overviews, architecture insights, refactoring reports, and unit test scaffolding. The extension maintains intelligent caching to ensure fast performance even on large codebases, with initial analysis taking 2-5 seconds for medium projects and incremental updates completing in under one second. Background processing ensures the extension never blocks code editing, providing a seamless development experience.
whatItDoes: Continuously monitors code and analyzes on every save to detect architecture issues
Detects god objects, circular dependencies, dead code, large files, and complex functions
Generates LLM-ready insights formatted specifically for Cursor, ChatGPT, and other AI assistants
Provides one-click copy buttons to share analysis with AI tools for refactoring help
Displays real-time health score showing overall codebase quality (0-100%)
Categorizes issues by severity (Error, Warning, Info) with actionable recommendations
Creates comprehensive product documentation explaining what applications do for users
Generates architecture insights describing system structure, components, and relationships
Produces detailed refactoring reports with prioritized improvement recommendations
Generates unit test scaffolding and test strategy recommendations
Supports nine programming languages: Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, Java, Go, Rust, C/C++, Ruby, PHP
Maintains intelligent caching for fast analysis with 80% time reduction on repeat operations
Provides clickable navigation from issues directly to code locations
Offers multiple output formats (Cursor, ChatGPT, Generic, Compact) optimized for different AI tools
Analyzes entire workspaces, individual files, or runs continuous background monitoring

Documentation maintenance by regenerating product and architecture docs as code evolves
Cross-team communication using exported markdown reports to share insights

Reduces time to get AI help by formatting insights specifically for LLM consumption

Accelerates refactoring decisions by providing AI-ready context for language models
Minimizes onboarding time for new developers through auto-generated product documentation
Identifies circular dependencies before they cause maintenance headaches
Detects god objects and large files that indicate poor separation of concerns
Finds dead code that clutters the codebase and confuses developers
Highlights complex functions that need simplification for maintainability

Eliminates context-switching by keeping all insights within VS Code
Maintains fast performance on large codebases through intelligent caching
Bridges the gap between static analysis and actionable AI-powered recommendations
Standardizes code quality assessment across development teams
architecture:
Shadow Watch is built on a modular architecture with clear separation between analysis engines, AI integration, presentation layers, and infrastructure services. The core analysis engine performs static code analysis using AST parsing to examine function-level structure, dependency graphing to track import relationships, and pattern detection to identify anti-patterns and code smells. This analysis runs continuously in the background, triggered by file save events through a file watcher service that monitors workspace changes. The analysis engine supports multiple programming languages through language-specific analyzers that understand the syntax and patterns of each supported language.

The AI integration layer connects to multiple LLM providers (OpenAI and Anthropic) through a provider abstraction with a factory pattern for runtime selection. This layer includes sophisticated prompt building that constructs detailed analysis requests with code context and schema definitions, response parsing that validates and extracts structured data from AI responses, rate limiting to handle API quotas gracefully, and retry logic with exponential backoff for resilience. A state manager maintains conversation context across multiple AI interactions, while a formatter system converts analysis results into different output formats optimized for various AI assistants (Cursor, ChatGPT, Generic, Compact).

The presentation layer consists of multiple specialized views including a tree view sidebar for navigating insights by category and severity, webview panels for displaying rich formatted documentation with syntax highlighting, and diagnostic providers for inline code annotations. A navigation handler enables clickable links that jump from insights to specific code locations. The infrastructure layer provides caching through both in-memory and persistent storage to optimize performance, progress tracking for long-running operations, error handling with graceful degradation, and a configuration manager for user preferences. The extension bootstraps through a command registry that exposes all functionality through the VS Code command palette, making every feature accessible via keyboard shortcuts and context menus.

descriptions.title: Continuous Code Monitoring
descriptions.description: Automatically analyzes code on every file save, providing real-time feedback on architecture issues without requiring manual triggers

descriptions.title: Architecture Issue Detection
descriptions.description: Identifies common code problems including god objects, circular dependencies, dead code, large files, and complex functions across nine programming languages

descriptions.title: LLM-Ready Insights
descriptions.description: Formats analysis results specifically for AI assistants like Cursor and ChatGPT, enabling one-click copy-paste workflows for getting AI refactoring help

descriptions.title: Multi-Format Output
descriptions.description: Provides four output formats (Cursor, ChatGPT, Generic, Compact) optimized for different AI tools and use cases

descriptions.title: Health Score Dashboard
descriptions.description: Displays overall codebase health as a percentage (0-100%) with breakdown of errors, warnings, and informational issues

descriptions.title: Smart Caching System
descriptions.description: Maintains intelligent cache of analysis results, reducing repeat analysis time by 80% and ensuring sub-second updates for file changes

descriptions.title: Clickable Navigation
descriptions.description: Every insight is clickable, allowing developers to jump directly from the sidebar to the exact code location that needs attention

descriptions.title: Product Documentation Generator
descriptions.description: Uses AI to generate comprehensive product documentation explaining what applications do from a user perspective, including features, workflows, and problems solved

descriptions.title: Architecture Insights Generator
descriptions.description: Creates detailed architecture documentation describing system structure, component relationships, design patterns, and data flow

descriptions.title: Refactoring Report Generator
descriptions.description: Produces prioritized refactoring recommendations with effort estimates, impact assessment, and step-by-step implementation plans

descriptions.title: Unit Test Scaffolding Generator
descriptions.description: Generates test strategy recommendations and unit test scaffolding for code lacking proper test coverage

descriptions.title: Multi-Language Support
descriptions.description: Analyzes code in Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, Java, Go, Rust, C/C++, Ruby, and PHP with language-specific pattern detection

descriptions.title: Background Analysis
descriptions.description: Performs all analysis in background processes that never block code editing, maintaining responsive editor performance

descriptions.title: Insight Categories
descriptions.description: Organizes detected issues into severity levels (Error, Warning, Info) with color coding for quick visual scanning

descriptions.title: Tree View Sidebar
descriptions.description: Main navigation interface showing categorized insights with expand/collapse sections and action buttons

descriptions.title: Webview Panels
descriptions.description: Rich HTML-based views for displaying formatted documentation with syntax highlighting, navigation links, and interactive elements

descriptions.title: Product Navigator
descriptions.description: Specialized view for exploring AI-generated product documentation with sections for features, workflows, and user perspectives

descriptions.title: Insights Viewer
descriptions.description: Comprehensive view showing all analysis results including architecture insights and refactoring recommendations

descriptions.title: Static Analysis Engine
descriptions.description: Core analysis system using AST parsing, dependency graphing, and pattern detection to examine code structure

descriptions.title: AI Provider System
descriptions.description: Abstraction layer supporting multiple LLM providers with runtime selection, rate limiting, and automatic failover

descriptions.title: File Watcher Service
descriptions.description: Monitors workspace for file changes and triggers incremental analysis of modified code

descriptions.title: Command Registry
descriptions.description: Central registration system exposing all extension features through VS Code command palette

descriptions.title: AI-Assisted Refactoring Workflow
descriptions.description: Developer writes code, Shadow Watch detects issues, developer copies insights to AI assistant, gets refactoring guidance, applies fixes, and verifies resolution

descriptions.title: Architecture Review Workflow
descriptions.description: Run workspace analysis, review categorized issues by severity, prioritize fixes based on health score impact, and track improvements over time

descriptions.title: Onboarding Workflow
descriptions.description: Generate product documentation for new team members, share architecture insights for system understanding, and provide context for code navigation

descriptions.title: Documentation Maintenance Workflow
descriptions.description: Periodically regenerate product and architecture documentation as codebase evolves, export to markdown for version control and sharing

relevantFunctions.name: analyzeWorkspace
relevantFunctions.description: Analyzes entire workspace for architecture issues and generates comprehensive insights

relevantFunctions.name: analyzeCurrentFile
relevantFunctions.description: Analyzes the currently active file in the editor and displays file-specific insights

relevantFunctions.name: copyAllInsights
relevantFunctions.description: Copies all workspace insights to clipboard formatted for the selected LLM provider

relevantFunctions.name: copyFileInsights
relevantFunctions.description: Copies insights for the current file to clipboard in LLM-ready format

relevantFunctions.name: copyInsight
relevantFunctions.description: Copies a specific insight item to clipboard formatted for AI assistant consumption

relevantFunctions.name: clearCache
relevantFunctions.description: Clears all cached analysis results to force fresh analysis

relevantFunctions.name: clearAllData
relevantFunctions.description: Removes all stored data including cache, settings, and analysis history

relevantFunctions.name: switchProvider
relevantFunctions.description: Switches between OpenAI and Anthropic AI providers for documentation generation

relevantFunctions.name: showProviderStatus
relevantFunctions.description: Displays current AI provider status including API key configuration and usage limits

relevantFunctions.name: setApiKey
relevantFunctions.description: Prompts user to enter OpenAI API key for AI-powered features

relevantFunctions.name: setClaudeApiKey
relevantFunctions.description: Prompts user to enter Anthropic Claude API key for AI-powered features

relevantFunctions.name: generateProductDocs
relevantFunctions.description: Uses AI to generate comprehensive product documentation from codebase analysis

relevantFunctions.name: generateLLMInsights
relevantFunctions.description: Generates AI-powered architecture insights explaining system structure and patterns

relevantFunctions.name: generateRefactoringReport
relevantFunctions.description: Creates detailed refactoring recommendations with prioritization and implementation plans

relevantFunctions.name: generateUnitTests
relevantFunctions.description: Generates unit test scaffolding and test strategy recommendations

relevantFunctions.name: detectGodObjects
relevantFunctions.description: Identifies files with excessive size or responsibility indicating god object anti-pattern

relevantFunctions.name: detectCircularDependencies
relevantFunctions.description: Analyzes import graphs to find circular dependency chains

relevantFunctions.name: detectDeadCode
relevantFunctions.description: Identifies unused functions, variables, and code blocks

relevantFunctions.name: analyzeComplexity
relevantFunctions.description: Calculates cyclomatic complexity and identifies overly complex functions

relevantFunctions.name: parseAST
relevantFunctions.description: Parses source code into abstract syntax tree for deep structural analysis

relevantDataStructures.name: AnalysisResult
relevantDataStructures.description: Complete analysis output containing health score, categorized issues, and metadata

relevantDataStructures.name: Insight
relevantDataStructures.description: Individual architecture issue with severity, category, description, location, and actionable suggestion

relevantDataStructures.name: HealthScore
relevantDataStructures.description: Overall codebase quality metric (0-100%) with breakdown by issue severity

relevantDataStructures.name: ProductDocumentation
relevantDataStructures.description: User-focused documentation including overview, features, workflows, and problems solved

relevantDataStructures.name: ArchitectureInsights
relevantDataStructures.description: System architecture description with components, patterns, data flow, and technology stack

relevantDataStructures.name: RefactoringReport
relevantDataStructures.description: Prioritized code improvement recommendations with effort estimates and implementation steps

relevantDataStructures.name: UnitTestReport
relevantDataStructures.description: Test strategy recommendations and generated unit test scaffolding

relevantDataStructures.name: LLMRequest
relevantDataStructures.description: Request structure for AI provider including prompt, model selection, and configuration parameters

relevantDataStructures.name: LLMResponse
relevantDataStructures.description: Parsed response from AI provider with generated content and usage metadata

relevantDataStructures.name: InsightCategory
relevantDataStructures.description: Categorization of insights by concern area (dependencies, organization, complexity, etc.)

relevantDataStructures.name: SeverityLevel
relevantDataStructures.description: Issue severity classification (Error, Warning, Info) for prioritization

relevantDataStructures.name: LLMFormat
relevantDataStructures.description: Output format specification for different AI assistants (Cursor, ChatGPT, Generic, Compact)

relevantDataStructures.name: CacheEntry
relevantDataStructures.description: Cached analysis result with timestamp and invalidation metadata

relevantDataStructures.name: FileAnalysis
relevantDataStructures.description: Analysis results for individual file including detected issues and metrics

relevantDataStructures.name: DependencyGraph
relevantDataStructures.description: Graph structure representing import/dependency relationships between files

relevantCodeFiles.purpose: Bootstraps the extension, initializes services, and registers all commands when VS Code starts
Performs AST parsing, dependency analysis, and pattern detection to identify architecture issues

relevantCodeFiles.description: AI provider integration and documentation generation
relevantCodeFiles.purpose: Manages communication with OpenAI and Anthropic to generate product docs, architecture insights, and refactoring reports
Provides rate limiting, retry logic, response parsing, and error recovery for AI requests
Shows categorized insights with health score, copy buttons, and clickable navigation to code
Displays formatted analysis results in rich HTML view with interactive elements
Shows AI-generated product documentation with features, workflows, and user perspectives
Shows generated test scaffolding and test strategy recommendations
Watches workspace files and triggers incremental analysis on save events
Maintains in-memory cache of analysis results for fast repeat access
Saves and loads analysis results to disk for persistence across sessions
Registers all VS Code commands and binds them to handler functions
Handles clicking on insights to open files at specific locations
Creates appropriate AI provider instance (OpenAI or Anthropic) based on configuration
Builds detailed prompts with code context, schemas, and instructions for AI analysis
Converts analysis results into different formats optimized for Cursor, ChatGPT, or other AI tools
Reads and updates user configuration including provider selection, formats, and thresholds
Formats AI-generated documentation into readable HTML or markdown
Provides graceful error handling with user-friendly messages and recovery strategies

exampleInput.description: Example workspace analysis request showing codebase structure provided to AI for generating product documentation
exampleInput.json: {"analysisType":"productDocumentation","codebaseStats":{"totalFiles":48,"totalLines":20935,"language":"typescript","healthScore":82},"detectedIssues":[{"severity":"error","category":"organization","description":"src/llmIntegration.ts has 2637 lines, indicating potential god object","file":"src/llmIntegration.ts","line":1,"suggestion":"Break this file into smaller, focused modules"},{"severity":"warning","category":"dependencies","description":"Circular dependency: src/analyzer.ts → src/cache.ts → src/analyzer.ts","suggestion":"Break cycle by introducing interface abstraction"}],"modules":[{"name":"src/ai","type":"other","fileCount":3,"capabilities":["AI provider integration","Rate limiting","Response parsing"]},{"name":"src/analysis","type":"other","fileCount":1,"capabilities":["Enhanced code analysis"]}],"entryPoints":[{"path":"src/extension.ts","exports":["activate","deactivate"]}],"budget":{"maxTokens":200000},"userPreferences":{"llmFormat":"cursor","severityThreshold":"warning"}}

exampleOutput.description: Example LLM-ready insight formatted for Cursor AI assistant showing how analysis results are presented to users
exampleOutput.json: {"format":"cursor","healthScore":82,"summary":"I have 12 architecture issues that need attention in this codebase:","criticalIssues":[{"severity":"error","category":"Code Organization","title":"Very Large File","description":"src/llmIntegration.ts has 2637 lines of code, indicating potential god object.","file":"src/llmIntegration.ts","line":1,"suggestion":"Break this file into smaller, focused modules. Consider separating concerns: API communication, response parsing, state management, and formatting into distinct files.","priority":"high"}],"warnings":[{"severity":"warning","category":"Dependencies","title":"Circular Dependency Detected","description":"Circular dependency: src/analyzer.ts → src/cache.ts → src/analyzer.ts","suggestion":"Break this cycle by introducing an interface/abstraction. Define ICacheProvider interface in separate file, have analyzer depend on interface, and inject cache implementation.","priority":"medium"}],"infoItems":[{"severity":"info","category":"Code Quality","title":"Complex Function","description":"Function analyzeComplexity in src/analyzer.ts has cyclomatic complexity of 15","suggestion":"Simplify by extracting helper functions or using early returns to reduce nesting.","priority":"low"}],"recommendations":["Start by addressing the god object in llmIntegration.ts - this will improve maintainability significantly","Break circular dependency to enable better testing and modularity","Consider simplifying complex functions once structural issues are resolved"],"nextSteps":"Would you like help refactoring the llmIntegration.ts file? I can suggest a specific module structure with clear separation of concerns."}
